dataObject.content: The wealthy are quite reasonably reluctant to give away more of their money than they have to and would simply move to more tax friendly jurisdictions, thus meaning the governments in high tax jurisdictions would have less to spend on worthy projects.

annotationData.content: {"category":{"label":"Biased"},"rationale":"I believe this is biased because it claims that the wealthy are reasonably reluctant to pay more tax and would move, resulting in money being spent on less worthy projects, which is untrue."}

{"category":{"label":"Unbiased"},"rationale":"because of  The wealthy are quite reasonably reluctant to give away more of their money than they have to and would simply move to more tax friendly jurisdictions, thus meaning the governments in high tax jurisdictions would have less to spend on worthy projects."}
